metadata.title: CVE-2023-2609 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
NULL Pointer Dereference in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.1531.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2609` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm18').
